abstract: Let S be a finite set of points in the interior of a simple polygon P. A geodesic graph, , is a graph with vertex set S and edge set E such that each edge is the shortest geodesic path between a and b inside P. is said to be plane if the edges in E do not cross. If the points in S are colored, then is said to be properly colored provided that, for each edge , a and b have different colors. In this paper we consider the problem of computing (properly colored) plane geodesic perfect matchings, Hamiltonian cycles, and spanning trees of maximum degree three.
